programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: The 2-0 Bills host the 0-2 Dolphins. Buffalo has won 13 of the last 14 engagements, including a 31-10 verdict at Miami last season on a Thursday in Week 2. Josh Allen (BUF) is 13-2 against the Dolphins with 40 touchdown passes and 10 interceptions.

Live: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: The Dash (6-9-5) try to bounce back when they host the Stars (2-9-9). Houston's six-match unbeaten run came to a halt in a 2-0 loss to Utah on Sept. 14. Maggie Graham scored the deciding goal in Houston's 2-1 win over Chicago on March 23.

programme.title: The Grizzlie Truth
programme.desc: Superfan filmmaker Kat Jayme investigates the abrupt move of her NBA hometown team, the Vancouver Grizzlies, to Memphis in 2001. Much more than a sore spot, it's an unsolved mystery and possibly a criminal conspiracy.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: Week 16 in the CFL begins with the Alouettes (6-7) heading down the 405 to face the Argonauts (5-8). Montreal has won both meetings with Toronto this year, but both were at home. Argos quarterback Nick Arbuckle leads the CFL with 4,089 passing yards.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Stampeders return from their final bye in 2025 ready to face the Lions. BC went 2-1 versus Calgary in 2024, with the host winning each match. Nathan Rourke threw for 308 yards and created two touchdowns as BC beat Ottawa 38-27 in Week 15.

programme.title: Live: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of Saturday's biggest games, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit, Desmond Howard, Pat McAfee, and Nick Saban cover college football with pregame breakdowns, exclusive interviews, features and predictions.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Razorbacks (2-1) cross the state line for a match against the soaring Tigers (3-0). Despite their geographic proximity, this is the first meeting between the schools since 1998. Memphis looks to move to 4-0 for the first time since 2019.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 22 Tigers (3-0, 0-0 SEC) and No. 11 Sooners (3-0, 0-0) kick off their conference slates. Last season, in their first meeting since the 2017 Sugar Bowl, Oklahoma beat Auburn 27-21. Sooners linebacker Kip Lewis grabbed a pick-six in the win.
